Name: Statuette of Ptah-Sokar-Osiris
Description: Mummiform wooden statuette representing Ptah-Sokar-Osiris, which belonged to Herunen, son of Djedher. The figure of the god is shown standing, enveloped in a bead net of a light colour with red circles on the intersections. He is wearing a tripartite wig on top of which are the solar disc and the double feathers. Around the neck is a wesekh-collar of different colours which ends, at both ends, in a falcon's head. Inscriptions cover the front and the back pillar. The figure rests on a rectangular pedestal with a cavity which is closed off by the figure of a falcon the plumage of which imitates the bead-net of the god.
